segment.source: Configure the AppLocker reference device (Windows 10)
segment.target: Configure the AppLocker reference device (Windows 10)

segment.source: This topic for the IT professional describes the steps to create an AppLocker policy platform structure on a reference computer.
segment.target: This topic for the IT professional describes the steps to create an AppLocker policy platform structure on a reference computer.

segment.source: Configure the AppLocker reference device
segment.target: Configure the AppLocker reference device

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: This topic for the IT professional describes the steps to create an AppLocker policy platform structure on a reference computer.
segment.target: This topic for the IT professional describes the steps to create an AppLocker policy platform structure on a reference computer.

segment.source: An AppLocker reference device that is used for the development and deployment of AppLocker policies should mimic the directory structure and corresponding applications in the organizational unit (OU) or business group for the production environment.
segment.target: An AppLocker reference device that is used for the development and deployment of AppLocker policies should mimic the directory structure and corresponding applications in the organizational unit (OU) or business group for the production environment.

segment.source: On a reference device, you can:
segment.target: On a reference device, you can:

segment.source: Maintain an application list for each business group.
segment.target: Maintain an application list for each business group.

segment.source: Develop AppLocker policies by creating individual rules or by creating a policy by automatically generating rules.
segment.target: Develop AppLocker policies by creating individual rules or by creating a policy by automatically generating rules.

segment.source: Create the default rules to allow the Windows system files to run properly.
segment.target: Create the default rules to allow the Windows system files to run properly.

segment.source: Run tests and analyze the event logs to determine the affect of the policies that you intend to deploy.
segment.target: Run tests and analyze the event logs to determine the affect of the policies that you intend to deploy.

segment.source: The reference device does not need to be joined to a domain, but it must be able to import and export AppLocker policies in XML format.
segment.target: The reference device does not need to be joined to a domain, but it must be able to import and export AppLocker policies in XML format.

segment.source: The reference computer must be running one of the supported editions of Windows as listed in Requirements to use AppLocker.
segment.target: The reference computer must be running one of the supported editions of Windows as listed in Requirements to use AppLocker.

segment.source: Warning: Do not use operating system snapshots when creating AppLocker rules.
segment.target: Warning: Do not use operating system snapshots when creating AppLocker rules.

segment.source: If you take a snapshot of the operating system, install an app, create AppLocker rules, and then revert to a clean snapshot and repeat the process for another app, there is a chance that duplicate rule GUIDs can be created.
segment.target: If you take a snapshot of the operating system, install an app, create AppLocker rules, and then revert to a clean snapshot and repeat the process for another app, there is a chance that duplicate rule GUIDs can be created.

segment.source: If duplicate GUIDs are present, AppLocker policies will not work as expected.
segment.target: If duplicate GUIDs are present, AppLocker policies will not work as expected.

segment.source: To configure a reference device
segment.target: To configure a reference device

segment.source: If the operating system is not already installed, install one of the supported editions of Windows on the device.
segment.target: If the operating system is not already installed, install one of the supported editions of Windows on the device.

segment.source: Note: If you have the Group Policy Management Console (GPMC) installed on another device to test your implementation of AppLocker policies, you can export the policies to that device
segment.target: Note: If you have the Group Policy Management Console (GPMC) installed on another device to test your implementation of AppLocker policies, you can export the policies to that device

segment.source: Configure the administrator account.
segment.target: Configure the administrator account.

segment.source: To update local policies, you must be a member of the local Administrators group.
segment.target: To update local policies, you must be a member of the local Administrators group.

segment.source: To update domain policies, you must be a member of the Domain Admins group or have been delegated privileges to use Group Policy to update a Group Policy Object (GPO).
segment.target: To update domain policies, you must be a member of the Domain Admins group or have been delegated privileges to use Group Policy to update a Group Policy Object (GPO).

segment.source: Install all apps that run in the targeted business group or OU by using the same directory structure.
segment.target: Install all apps that run in the targeted business group or OU by using the same directory structure.

segment.source: The reference device should be configured to mimic the structure of your production environment.
segment.target: The reference device should be configured to mimic the structure of your production environment.

segment.source: It depends on having the same apps in the same directories to accurately create the rules.
segment.target: It depends on having the same apps in the same directories to accurately create the rules.

segment.source: See also
segment.target: See also

segment.source: After you configure the reference computer, you can create the AppLocker rule collections.
segment.target: After you configure the reference computer, you can create the AppLocker rule collections.

segment.source: You can build, import, or automatically generate the rules.
segment.target: You can build, import, or automatically generate the rules.

segment.source: For procedures to do this, see Working with AppLocker rules.
segment.target: For procedures to do this, see Working with AppLocker rules.

segment.source: Use a reference device to create and maintain AppLocker policies
segment.target: Use a reference device to create and maintain AppLocker policies
